parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "environment": "milex",
    "python_script": "train_rim.py",
    "data_path": "$HOME/scratch/RIM_xray_spectra/data/",
    "prior_model": "$HOME/scratch/RIM_xray_spectra/models/score_xray_clusters_20230731_2",
    "prior_temperature": 0.1,
    "logdir": "$HOME/scratch/RIM_xray_spectra/models/",
    "logname_prefix": "rim_xray_clusters_heavy_with_prior",
    "snr_max": 100,
    "snr_min": 5,
    "noise_distribution": "log_uniform",
    "hyperparameters": "$HOME/scratch/RIM_xray_spectra/scripts/rim_xray_heavy_hparams.json",
    "epochs": 20000,
    "clip": 1,
    "ema_decay": 0.99,
    "batch_size": 32,
    "learning_rate": 1e-4,
    "checkpoints": 1,
    "models_to_keep": 3,
    "max_time": 22,
    "lr_schedule_step_size": 1000,
    "lr_schedule_gamma": 0.7,
    "resources": {
      "tasks": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 1,
      "gpu": 1,
      "memory": "32G",
      "time": "00-23:00",
      "account": "rrg-lplevass",
      "job_name": "Train_RIM_xray_prior"
    }
  }
}
```

The script uses SLURM (Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management) to manage the execution of a Python script. It requests specific resources like a GPU, CPU, memory, and time from the cluster. The script uses a virtual environment called "milex" to run the Python script "train_rim.py" with specific parameters, likely for machine learning training.  The script also defines parameters related to the training process such as the learning rate, batch size, and epochs.
